snippet.title: Building approvals rose 10.9% in June
snippet.content: Approvals for the construction of new homes rose 10.9 per cent in June, beating market expectations of a 1.0 per cent increase. Approvals for private sector houses rose 3.4 per cent in June, and the 'other dwellings' category, which includes apartment blocks and townhouses, was up 20 per cent. Over the 12 months to June, building approvals were down 2.3 per cent, the Australian Bureau of Statistics said on Wednesday. Originally published as
